lines.text: Measure of disorder (randomness) of a system
The entropy of an isolated system cannot  decrease
The total entropy of the universe is increasing

secText:
Essential Question:
How can we measure the order of a system?

Enduring Understandings:
1. The second law of thermodynamics states that the [OBJ:expsec_l076:entropy] (randomness) of a system always [OBJ:expsec_l079:increases or remains constant].
